page.title: 05Undercliff. Communications
page.content: The main road from St.Lawrence to Niton is now in its second place, having originally been much closer to the cliff.From Niton Undercliff to Blackgang the early road was improved in about 1838 and was an immensely popular drive until it was lost in the great cliff fall and landslip of 1928. It was not possible to reconstruct it and a new road was built in 1933 from Upper Niton over the southern end of St.Catherine's Down;this road affords a superb view across the great bay to Freshwater and sweeps down in easy curves to join the old road on the west of Blackgang.In the summer there is heavy tourist traffic,causing some congestion,especially along the Under- cliff Drive and through Niton.However, straightening and widening these roads will only result in destroying the character of the area.
